item.title: The Best Open-World SciFi Games
item.description: Players have fallen in love with the unparalleled freedom offered in Open-World games. When it comes to settings, there's no backdrop that offers more freedom than the starry worlds and dystopian cities of science fiction.

item.title: Fortnite: How To Get Pirates of the Caribbean Skins
item.description:
Pirates of the Caribbean x Fortnite brings forth 5 iconic characters from the Pirates of the Caribbean franchise, allowing them to roam Fortnite 's many modes in players' lockers. There is plenty of potential for more Pirates of the Caribbean skins in Fortnite , especially as the game continues to grow in seasons, modes, and collabs. Yet, the focus here is entirely on the most iconic pirates put to the silver screen thanks to Disney.

Fans can finally get their hands on the Pirates of the Caribbean skins in Fortnite after months of waiting and weeks of teasing. Each of these pirates has an individual desire, but is it for V-Bucks?, Players can claim these outfits to quell their own, provided that they have the V-Bucks and the patience, as there are quite a few cosmetics to get through for the Fortnite x Pirates of the Caribbean collab event.

Pirates of the Caribbean Bundle

3,400 V-Bucks and 12 Items

Heading to the Item Shop on July 17, 8 PM ET, players can acquire a bundle involving all Pirates of the Caribbean skins and cosmetics (minus Jack Sparrow). This bundle costs 3,400 V-Bucks, which will save players 1,800 V-Bucks if they were to buy the three skins and the emote individually. To those buying the bundle, they will receive these 12 items:

  • Davy Jones (Outfit)
  • Davy Jones (LEGO Style)
  • Lil Kraken (Back Bling)
  • Norrington's Sacrifice (Pickaxe)
  • Davy's Pipe Organ (Emote)
  • Captain Barbossa (Outfit)
  • Captain Barbossa (LEGO Style)
  • Barbossa's Sword (Pickaxe)
  • Elizabeth Swann (Outfit)
  • Elizabeth Swann (LEGO Style)
  • Dead Man's Chest (Back Bling)
  • Elizabeth's Favor (Pickaxe)

If players do not want to obtain all of these items, and would instead prefer to spend a sum of V-Bucks on one individual skin, then they can most certainly do that, and the V-Bucks pricing of each Pirates of the Caribbean skin can be found below.

How to Get Davy Jones

(1,600 V-Bucks and 4 Items)

  • Infamous captain of the Flying Dutchman.

Davy Jones is a villain who needs no introduction. This former man does not fear death, and his loyal crew served under him for 100 years or more. As the captain of the Flying Dutchman, Davy Jones has guided many to their deaths, and his octopus and crab appearance makes him a dreaded threat on the seven seas, and an impressive design to use in Battle Royale. Players don't have to worry about his crab leg and crab claw, as it won't slow him down in a fight. The skin looks great, but even better is the LEGO Davy Jones, which comes with a crab peg leg to run around on, usable in LEGO Fortnite modes.

Lil Kraken (Back Bling)

  • Awww, he just woke up!

Davy Jones' Kraken is often unleashed on hunted ships, laying waste to those who seek fortune on the seven seas. Whilst the Kraken may have unfortunately been killed, this adorable addition in a bottle implies that Davy Jones still had a baby version waiting to grow into a truly diabolical monster, and its eyes and tentacles will move around in a responsive manner. Sadly, if players just want Lil Kraken, they are going to need to spend 1,600 V-Bucks on Davy Jones.

Norrington's Sacrifice (Pickaxe)

  • Plundered from a doomed opponent of Davy Jones.

Even a pirate without a heart needs a sword, and there was no stronger heart against Jones than Norrington, a man who thrust his blade into Davy Jones with his dying breath in an effort to show he fearless he was when facing down death. Norrington's Sacrifice is a great sword to honor both Norrington and strike fear into enemies, for this is a blade steeped in death and the depths of the Flying Dutchman, but players will need to purchase Davy Jones to get it.

How to Get Elizabeth Swann

(1,600 V-Bucks and 4 Items)

  • Pirate King and captain of her fleet.

The brave Elizabeth Swann always stood up for herself and the man she loved, even if it got her into plenty of trouble with pirates, ghosts, ghouls, and the East India Trading Company. Elizabeth's outfit comes from the beginning of Pirates of the Caribbean: At World's End , instead of towards the end with her Pirate King attire. With the option to wear her hat or take it off to reveal golden locks, players can enjoy running around as Elizabeth Turner for 1,600 V-Bucks, along with some other goodies like a LEGO style to be used in LEGO Fortnite .

Dead Man's Chest (Back Bling)

  • The Flying Dutchman must have a Captain!

A rather important item in the Pirates of the Caribbean movies, and now a Back Bling for everyone to chase after, the Dead Man's Chest held the beating heart of Davy Jones. Whoever controlled the chest controlled the heart, and whoever controlled the heart controlled the sea thanks to the fate of Davy Jones' Flying Dutchman. To get this Back Bling, players must purchase Elizabeth Swann.

Elizabeth's Favor (Pickaxe)

  • The sword of her pirate husband, Will Turner.

Every pirate needs a good sword, and Elizabeth's Favor is crafted from a great blacksmith. Will Turner is the husband of Elizabeth Swann, and it seems that in his absence in this collab, his sword has been gifted to Elizabeth to wield against 99 other players and to harvest materials to crank 90s. If players want this sword, then they will need to purchase Elizabeth Swann.

How to Get Captain Barbossa

(1,500 V-Bucks and 3 Items)

  • Master pirate and mutineer.

Coming in at the cheapest of the skins, Barbossa will cost players 1,500 V-Bucks as opposed to the standard 1,600. His price is nothing to mock, as Hector Barbossa is one of the most cunning and respected pirates, and it seems his love for the Black Pearl is followed by a passionate crew for plunder. Barbossa sadly isn't joined by his pet monkey, Jack, but it's still great to see this master Pirate Lord at play. Like the others, purchasing Barbossa will grant players a LEGO variant to be used in LEGO Fortnite .

Barbossa's Sword (Pickaxe)

  • You better start believing in ghost stories.

Barbossa is a brilliant pirate, which is exactly why it would be unwise to face him with a sword unless a parley is in place. Barbossa's sword has seen plenty of action, and for Fortnite , it is now but a humble Pickaxe for players to use to harvest materials and strike at their foes for 40 damage. Yet, what is a pirate without a sword? Players will need to purchase Barbossa if they are to obtain this Pickaxe.

Davy's Pipe Organ

500 V-Bucks Emote

  • Play it loud enough for Calypso to hear.

Davy Jones' heart is eternally bound to his dear Calypso, the goddess of the sea. Trapped in this body and with the responsibility of the Flying Dutchman, Jones spends his private moments playing his pipe organ, with heartbreak and rage. The emote is just as creepy, but equally as cool as it was when seen in the movies. This is a separate Pirates of the Caribbean item that can be purchased for 500 V-Bucks, unrelated to other skins.

When Do The Pirates of the Caribbean Skins Leave the Item Shop?

The Pirates of the Caribbean skins are set to leave the Item Shop on July 31, 8 PM ET. Whilst it is extremely likely that these skins will return, especially with the Jack Sparrow Cursed Sails Pass still being active for another week after that, nothing is confirmed, and the rights to collab skins such as these are always a tricky and unpredictable matter.

How To Get Jack Sparrow

  • That's "Captain" Jack Sparrow.

Jack Sparrow becomes available for purchase on July 19. This outfit is exclusive to those who spend 1,000 V-Bucks on the Cursed Sails Pass, a Pirates of the Caribbean event pass that will expire on August 6, so players have a few weeks to obtain Jack Sparrow and the other assortment of cosmetics that join him on his pirate adventure into Fortnite. Fans can get their hands on Jack Sparrow and his LEGO style for LEGO Fortnite . On top of that, he has 2 styles to choose from, with his hat on or off for players to use. Yet, Jack Sparrow isn't the only treasure that players can earn from the Cursed Sails Pass.

How To Get Cursed Jack Sparrow

  • That's "Cursed Captain" Jack Sparrow.

Cursed Jack Sparrow is not an alternate style of Jack Sparrow, but instead a whole new outfit that comes as part of the Cursed Sails Pass , purchased for 1,000 V-Bucks. Whilst Jack Sparrow can be acquired straight away with the premium track, players will have to progress through the premium track to reach the Tier 11 reward , which also comes with a LEGO Style. Cursed Jack Sparrow is an interesting addition to the game, as it fits perfectly with the spooky themes of Halloween, and even the more horror aspects of the Pirates of the Caribbean series. Wearing this skin, players will be able to see through Jack Sparrow for his skeletal appearance is rather thin, bringing one of the rarest player models into the game.

item.title: Shin Megami Tensei 5: Vengeance: Horn Of Plenty Quest Walkthrough
item.description:
Quick Links

  • How To Start The Horn Of Plenty
  • How To Beat Chimera
  • What Should You Tell Demeter & Rewards

Shin Megami Tensei 5: Vengeance has a few subquests that will unlock others following the same demons throughout different locations in the game. One of these questlines is Demeter's, and can still be found in both the Canon of Vengeance and Canon of Creation.

Demeter's first quest is The Tyrant of Tennozu, and after completing it she will move to a later region in the game. Her next quest will have players facing another powerful demon, slightly higher in level than those in the nearby area.

This article is based on the Canon of Vengeance

How To Start The Horn Of Plenty


After completing the Tyrant of Tennozu, Demeter will move to Shinjuku, in a building just south of the Shinjuku 3rd Block Leyline Fount . Demeter will not appear if the previous quest hasn't been turned in, and will immediately travel to this location if players need to backtrack to unlock this quest. Demeter will ask for the Horn of Plenty, which is dropped by a Chimera found back at the beginning of Shinjuku. If players have already found and defeated this demon, they will already have the Horn and can turn in the quest immediately.

The Chimera is found in a small valley in the southeastern corner of Shinjuku and can be easily reached by traveling back to the first Leyline fount and traveling southwest before climbing up the hill and following the path straight east. Chimera will attack as soon as you approach, so be prepared before getting too close.

How To Beat Chimera

Resistances

Block

Weaknesses

  • Fire
  • Sleep
  • Mirage
  • Confuse
  • Charm
  • Seal

  • Electric

  • Force
  • Poison

Chimera is a powerful level 50 demon, but its weakness to poison should be immediately taken advantage of. While it is best to fuse a demon that has a poison ability, players can also use a Poison Gem to poison Chimera during the first turn to maximize damage from the status effect. If you chose a magic build for the Nahobino, be sure to bring a powerful force spell and focus only on dealing damage and adding more press turn icons.

Chimera has a few options of its own, and players should focus on demons that resist or block fire and electric attacks. Having a block or absorb fire demon or essence on the Nahobino is best as its only fire spell is Maragion which will hit the whole party and end its turn . Players should also bring Amrita Drops or other status healing spells as Frenzied Chomp has a chance of inflicting poison, confusion, or charm.

What Should You Tell Demeter & Rewards

After defeating Chimera players will be given the Horn of Plenty and can take it back to Demeter. She will ask about sacrifices and players can choose between, "Sacrifices are necessary" or, "Sacrifices should be avoided". No matter what option you choose, the end results for this quest will be the same , and Demeter can be found again later in the game to continue her quest line.

Upon completing this quest, players will be given the Megami Talisman. This Talisman gives Megami demons access to the Magatsuhi skill Eternal Prayer, which restores HP, cures status ailments, and revives all allies even in your stock . This is one of the best healing Magatsuhi skills in the game and is a great last-resort option against difficult bosses.
